energy_sources_details.title: Solar Energy
energy_sources_details.description: Solar energy is harnessed from the sun's rays using photovoltaic cells or solar thermal technology. Photovoltaic cells convert sunlight directly into electricity, while solar thermal technology uses sunlight to heat a fluid and generate electricity. Solar energy is clean, renewable, and abundant, making it a popular choice for generating electricity and heating water for residential and commercial purposes.

energy_sources_details.title: Wind Energy
energy_sources_details.description: Wind energy is generated by harnessing the kinetic energy of moving air through wind turbines. These turbines convert the wind's rotational energy into electricity. Wind power is a sustainable and emissions-free energy source, making it an essential part of the renewable energy mix. Wind farms are often installed in windy regions and offshore locations to maximize electricity generation.

energy_sources_details.title: Hydropower
energy_sources_details.description: Hydropower, also known as hydroelectric power, is derived from the energy of flowing or falling water. It is one of the oldest renewable energy sources used to generate electricity. Hydropower plants use dams and reservoirs to store water, and as water is released from higher levels to lower levels, it spins turbines, which, in turn, produce electricity. Hydropower is a reliable and eco-friendly energy source with low greenhouse gas emissions.

energy_sources_details.title: Biomass Energy
energy_sources_details.description: Biomass energy is produced from organic materials like plant matter, agricultural residues, wood pellets, and organic waste. These materials can be burned directly or converted into biofuels like biogas, bioethanol, and biodiesel. Biomass energy is considered renewable because plants and organic materials can be regrown or replenished. It is often used for heat and electricity generation and as a sustainable alternative to fossil fuels.

energy_sources_details.title: Geothermal Energy
energy_sources_details.description: Geothermal energy is obtained from the heat generated within the Earth's crust. It involves harnessing hot water and steam from geothermal reservoirs underground to produce electricity through geothermal power plants. Geothermal energy is a reliable and sustainable energy source, as it produces minimal greenhouse gas emissions and has a small land footprint compared to other renewable energy sources.
